## Do Not Confuse Correlation with Causality

::: incremental
-   "CoReLlAtIoN dOeS nOt MeAn CaUsAlItY".
-   Sometimes there are causal relationships between two things and yet no observable correlation.
-   Human beings engaging in optimal behavior are the main reason correlations almost never reveal causal relationships, because rarely are human beings acting randomly.
-   The presence of randomness that is crucial for identifying causal effect.
:::

## Causal Relationship Can Also Be Tricky

::: incremental
 
- There exists causal relationship between alcohol consumption and automotive fatalities
- What if we restricted data to >10 drinks per day

- ![Causal Relationship with no Correlation](pics/causal_no_correlation_ch1.jpg)

- Correlation is (a) product of data available; (b) measures linear dependency

:::
